[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: WriteAddendum] [Medium - Buffer Overflow] Does WriteAddendum::write() validate buffer sizes to prevent overflow attacks during serialization?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Impl: WriteAddendum for ()] [Low - Unit Type Serialization] The () implementation writes nothing - is this distinguishable from serialization errors?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [High - Secret in Memory] The secret share is used in signing - how long does it remain in memory unzeroized, risking cold boot or side-channel attacks?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [High - Nonce Zeroizing] Nonces are wrapped in Zeroizing but passed as Vec - can the Vec allocation leak nonce data before zeroization?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: Schnorr] [Medium - Challenge in Memory] self.c stores the challenge - is this sensitive data properly zeroized when the Schnorr instance is dropped?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: IetfTranscript::append_message()] [Medium - Transcript in Memory] The transcript vector grows unbounded - can this leak sensitive data through memory analysis?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [High - Send + Sync] The trait requires Send + Sync - can concurrent access to mutable state (transcript, challenge) cause data races?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: Schnorr] [High - Shared State] If Schnorr instances are shared across threads, can concurrent sign_share() and verify() calls corrupt self.c?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Transcript] [Medium - Thread Safety] The Transcript trait requires Sync - can non-atomic transcript operations cause race conditions?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify()] [Critical - Unwrap Panic] unwrap() on None causes panic - can an attacker trigger this deliberately to DoS the signing system?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify_share()] [Critical - Unwrap Panic] unwrap() on None causes panic - can verification requests before signing cause validator crashes?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: IetfTranscript::rng_seed()] [High - Unimplemented Panic] unimplemented!() will crash if called - can this be triggered through unexpected API usage?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [High - Index Panic] swap_remove(0) panics on empty Vec - can nonce array mismatches cause validator crashes?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify()] [High - Index Panic] nonces[0][0] panics on out-of-bounds - can malformed nonce arrays from Byzantine validators crash honest nodes?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify_share()] [High - Index Panic] nonces[0][0] panics on out-of-bounds - can invalid share verification requests cause DoS?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [Critical - Preprocess Reuse] The trait doesn't enforce preprocess uniqueness - can nonce reuse across signing sessions leak private keys?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [Critical - Threshold Enforcement] The trait doesn't specify t-of-n threshold logic - can implementations accept fewer than t shares and produce invalid signatures?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [High - Rogue Key Prevention] The trait doesn't enforce proof-of-knowledge for keys - can rogue key attacks enable signature forgery?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Algorithm] [High - Binding Factor] The trait doesn't specify binding factor calculation - can implementations omit it and enable unforgeability attacks?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Struct: Schnorr] [High - No Binding Factor] The Schnorr implementation doesn't explicitly show binding factor logic - is it handled in the nonce combination 'd + (e * p)'?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [High - Session Binding] Is the signing session ID bound to the challenge to prevent cross-session replay attacks?

[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::sign_share()] [High - DLP Hardness] Does the implementation assume computational Diffie-Hellman (CDH) hardness on the curve? Can weak curves break this?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Trait: Hram] [High - Random Oracle] Does H::hram() satisfy random oracle model requirements? Can weak hash functions enable forgery?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Algorithm::sign_share()] [Medium - Scalar Multiplication] Are scalar multiplications constant-time to prevent timing attacks that leak key bits?
[File: serai/crypto/frost/src/algorithm.rs] [Function: Schnorr::verify()] [Medium - Point Addition] Are point additions constant-time to prevent timing side-channels during verification?
